constitutionalAuthorityStatementText:
[Congressional Record Volume 168, Number 13 (Thursday, January 20, 2022)]
[House]
From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]
By Mrs. WAGNER:
H.R. 6465.
Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuant
to the following:
(1) section 8 of article I, to make all laws necessary and
proper for carrying into execution the powers vested by the
Constitution of the United States, including the power to
regulate commerce under clause 3 of such section; and (2)
section 5 of the 14th Amendment, including the power to
enforce the prohibition on government action denying equal
protection of the laws
[Page H290]

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on the Constitution, Civil Rights, and Civil Liberties.

title: PRENDA Act of 2022
